headline: Oracle (ORCL) Is Down 16.2% After Massive AI Data Center Spend Triggers Cash Flow Concerns
summary: In its fiscal second quarter ended November 30, 2025, Oracle reported revenue of US$16.06 billion and net income of US$6.14 billion, while also declaring a quarterly dividend of US$0.50 per share payable in January 2026. At the same time, Oracle ramped up AI‑related data center spending to an expected US$50 billion for fiscal 2026, sparking concerns about rising debt, negative free cash flow, and execution risks around massive contracts such as its very large OpenAI agreement. We’ll now...

content.title: Oracle (ORCL) Is Down 16.2% After Massive AI Data Center Spend Triggers Cash Flow Concerns
content.summary: In its fiscal second quarter ended November 30, 2025, Oracle reported revenue of US$16.06 billion and net income of US$6.14 billion, while also declaring a quarterly dividend of US$0.50 per share payable in January 2026. At the same time, Oracle ramped up AI‑related data center spending to an expected US$50 billion for fiscal 2026, sparking concerns about rising debt, negative free cash flow, and execution risks around massive contracts such as its very large OpenAI agreement. headline: GE Vernova’s New Business Looks Like Another AI Data Center Play
summary: GE Vernova  is developing a new business line, and it could shake up the market for artificial-intelligence data center power solutions.  The company said at an investor day last week it is working on manufacturing fuel cells, which are devices that operate a little like batteries to generate electricity.  Unlike batteries, fuel cells are powered by fuels like hydrogen or natural gas that make electricity through chemical reactions.

content.title: GE Vernova’s New Business Looks Like Another AI Data Center Play
content.summary: GE Vernova  is developing a new business line, and it could shake up the market for artificial-intelligence data center power solutions.  The company said at an investor day last week it is working on manufacturing fuel cells, which are devices that operate a little like batteries to generate electricity.  Unlike batteries, fuel cells are powered by fuels like hydrogen or natural gas that make electricity through chemical reactions.

headline: AI Bonds Stay Under Pressure
summary: Worries that debt-fueled investments might not pan out as hoped have been weighing on the bonds issued by the likes of CoreWeave and Oracle in recent weeks.  Pressure on CoreWeave bonds has been particularly acute.  Its 9.25% bonds due in 2030 traded at around 90.6 cents on the dollar on Tuesday, down from 91.8 cents on Monday, according to MarketAxess.

content.title: AI Bonds Stay Under Pressure
content.summary: Worries that debt-fueled investments might not pan out as hoped have been weighing on the bonds issued by the likes of CoreWeave and Oracle in recent weeks.  Pressure on CoreWeave bonds has been particularly acute.  Its 9.25% bonds due in 2030 traded at around 90.6 cents on the dollar on Tuesday, down from 91.8 cents on Monday, according to MarketAxess.
